Garrison

Garrison is an object which holds units and groups and handles their lifecycle (spawning, despawning, destruction).  Garrison is much like a group, it has an <AIGarrison>. But it can have multiple groups of different types.

Author: Sparker 12.07.2018

Functions
new

Parameters: _side, _pos

_side

side of this garrison

_pos

optional, default position to set to the garrison

delete
activate

Start AI Registers with commander and global garrison list Sets "active" variable to true

!! Must be called from commander thread !!

Returns: GarrisonModel

activateOutOfThread

Same as activate, for calling outside the commander thread.

Returns: nil

destroy

This starts the delete process for this garrison. It sets the garrison to destroyed state (isDestroyed returns true, isAlive returns false), removes all units and groups, deletes the timer and AI components.

isAlive

Is this Garrison ready to be used?

isDestroyed

Is this Garrison ready to be used?

(static) getAllActive

Returns all garrisons

Parameters: _sidesInclude, _sidesExclude

_sidesInclude

optional, Sides of garrisons to include. If _sidesInclude is not provided, include all garrisons.

_sidesExclude

optional, Sides of garrisons to exclude. If _sidesExclude is not provided, no garrisons are excluded.

Returns: Array with Garrison objects

(static) getAllNotEmpty

Returns all active non empty garrisons

Parameters: _sidesInclude, _sidesExclude

_sidesInclude

optional, Sides of garrisons to include. If _sidesInclude is not provided, include all garrisons.

_sidesExclude

optional, Sides of garrisons to exclude. If _sidesExclude is not provided, no garrisons are excluded.

Returns: Array with Garrison objects

(static) getAll

Returns absolutely all garrison objects

getMessageLoop

See MessageReceiver.getMessageLoop

Returns: MessageLoop

Parameters: _faction _faction - string

setName

Parameters: _name _name - string

setLocation

Sets the location of this garrison

Parameters: _location

_location

Location

enableAutoSpawn

Enables auto spawning of this garrison.  It will make it update its spawn state when inactive.  Useful for some 'ambient' garrisons such as city garrisons.

Parameters: _enable

bool

setPos

Sets the position of this garrison. Note that position can be updated later on its own by garrison's actions.

Parameters: _pos

_pos

position

getFaction
Returns: faction

string

getSide

Returns side of this garrison.

Returns: Side

getLocation

Returns location this garrison is attached to.

Returns: Location

getGroups

Returns groups of this garrison.

Returns: Array of Group objects.

getUnits

Returns all units of this garrison.

Returns: Array of Unit objects.

getInfantryUnits

Returns all infantry units.

Returns: Array of units.

getOfficerUnits

Returns only officer units.

Returns: Array of officers.

getVehiucleUnits

Returns all vehicle units.

Returns: Array of units.

getVehicleUnits

Returns: Array of units.

Returns all cargo units.

Returns: number

getAI

Returns the AI object of this garrison.

Returns: Array of Unit objects.

getPos

Returns the position of the garrison. It's the same as position world state property.

Returns: Array

isEmpty

Returns true if garrison is empty (has no units)

Returns: Bool

isOnlyEmptyVehicles

Returns true if garrison contains only empty vehicles

Returns: Bool

isSpawned

Returns true if garrison is spawned

Returns: Bool

findGroupsByType

Finds groups in this garrison that have the same type as _type

Parameters: _type

_type

Number, one of <GROUP_TYPE>, or Array with such numbers

Returns: Array with Group objects.

countAllUnits

Returns: total number of units in this garrison.

getTransportCapacity

Count number of passenger seats available in all vehicles of the categories specified.  Parameters: _vehicleCategories

_vehicleCategories

Array of vehicle categories, defaults to T_VEH_ground_infantry_cargo Returns: number of seats available.

addUnit

Adds an existing unit to this garrison. Also use it if you want to move ungrouped units between garrisons.  Unit should be not in agroup since this function doesn't move unit's group to this garrison. So, only vehicles should be added/moved this way.

Threading: should be called through postMethod (see <MessageReceiverEx>)

Parameters: _unit

_unit

Unit object

Returns: nil

addUnits

Same as addUnit, but for an array of units.

Parameters: _units

_units

array of Unit object

Returns: nil

captureUnit

Same as addUnit, but also ungroups the unit if it's in a group. Should be used only on vehicles/cargo boxes.

Threading: should be called through postMethod (see <MessageReceiverEx>)

Parameters: _unit

_unit

Unit object

Returns: nil

removeUnit

Removes a unit from this garrison.  Threading: should be called through postMethod (see <MessageReceiverEx>)

Parameters: _unit

_unit

Unit object

Returns: nil

addGroup

Adds an existing group to this garrison. Also use it when you want to move a group to another garrison.

Threading: should be called through postMethod (see <MessageReceiverEx>)

Parameters: _group

_unit

Group object

Returns: nil

removeGroup

Removes an existing group from this garrison.  You don't need to call this. Use addGroup when you need to move groups between garrisons.

Parameters: _group

_unit

Group object

Returns: nil

deleteEmptyGroups

DeletesEmptyGroups in this garrison

Returns: nil

addGarrison

Moves all units and groups from another garrison to this one.

Parameters: _garrison

_garrison

Garrison object

Returns: nil

capturesGarrison

Captures all units from another garrison to this one. The other garrison must not have any infantry.  See difference between addUnit and captureUnit.

Parameters: _garrison, _destroy

_garrison

Garrison object

_destroy

bool, default true, will destroy the source garrison on success.

Returns: nil

addUnitsAndGroups

Moves all specified units and groups from another garrison to this one.  Before moving, it ensures that all provided units are still in this garrison.  New groups for infantry units and vehicle units are created.  ALl provided units and groups must originate in one garrison!

Parameters: _garrison, _units, _groups

_garSrc

source Garrison

_units

array of Unit objects

_groupsAndUnits

array of [_group, _units]

Returns: Bool, true if move was performed properly

addUnitsFromCompositionClassNames

Adds units to this garrison from another garrison.  Unit arrangement is specified by composition array with class names.

Parameters: _garSrc, _comp

_garSrc

source Garrison

_comp

composition array. See "compositionClassNames" member variable and how it's organized.

Returns: Number, amount of unsatisfied matches. 0 if all composition elements were matched.

addUnitsFromCompositionNumbers

Adds units to this garrison from another garrison.  Unit arrangement is specified by composition array with numbers.

Parameters: _garSrc, _comp

_garSrc

source Garrison

_comp

composition array. See "compositionNumbers" member variable and how it's organized.

Returns: Bool, true if transfer was successfull.

getRequiredCrew

Returns amount of needed drivers and turret operators for all vehicles in this garrison.

Returns: [_nDrivers, _nTurrets]

mergeVehicleGroups

Merges or splits vehicle group(s)

Parameters: _merge

_merge

Bool, true to merge, false to split

Returns: nil

increaseCounters

Adds values to efficiency vector and other counters

Private use!

Returns: nil

subEfficiency

Substracts values from efficiency vector and other counters

Private use!

Returns: nil

getEfficiencyMobile

Returns efficiency of all mobile units

Returns: Efficiency vector

getEfficiencyTotal

Returns efficiency of all mobile units

Returns: Efficiency vector

getSubagents

Returns subagents of this agent.  For garrison it returns an empty array, because the subagents of garrison (groups) are processed in a separate thread.

Access: Used by AI class

Returns: [].

handleUnitKilled

Called when the unit has been killed.

Must be called inside the garrison thread through postMethodAsync, not inside event handler.

Returns: nil

handleGetInVehicle

Called when someone enters a vehicle that belongs to this garrison.

Must be called inside the garrison thread through postMethodAsync, not inside event handler.

Parameters: _unitVeh, _unitInf

_unitVeh

the vehicle

_unitInf

the unit that entered the vehicle

Returns: nil

handleCargoLoaded

Called when someone loads a cargo unit that belongs to this garrison.

Must be called inside the garrison thread through postMethodAsync, not inside event handler.

Parameters: _unitCargo, _unitVehicle

_unitCargo

the cargo item (static gun or cargo box or whatever) which was loaded

_unitVehicle

the vehicle unit into which the cargo was loaded

Returns: nil

findUnits

Returns an array of units with specified category and subcategory

Parameters: _query

_query

array of [_catID, _subcatID].  _subcatID can be -1 if you don't care about a subcategory match.

Returns: Array of units Unit class

countUnits

Counts amount of units with specified category and subcategory

Parameters: _query

_query

array of [_catID, _subcatID].  _subcatID can be -1 if you don't care about a subcategory match.

Returns: Array of units Unit class

countInfantryUnits

Returns the amount of infantry units

Returns: Number

Returns the amount of officers

Returns: Number

countVehicleUnits

Returns the amount of vehicle units

Returns: Number

countDroneUnits

Returns the amount of drone units

Returns: Number

countCargoUnits

Returns the amount of cargo units

Returns: Number

copyIntelFrom

Calls AI.copyIntelFrom another garrison's AI.

Parameters: _gar

another garrison

updateSpawnedUnitsIntel

Updates intel of units if this garrison is spawned

spawn

Despawns all groups and units in this garrison.

Threading: should be called through postMethod (see <MessageReceiverEx>)

Returns: nil

spawn

Spawns all groups and units in this garrison, if it's not currently spawned.

Threading: should be called through postMethod (see <MessageReceiverEx>)

Returns: nil
